content: Yes, unfortunately, there are several endangered bird species in the Amazon rainforest. One such species is the harpy eagle, which is considered one of the largest eagles in the world. Other endangered bird species include the hyacinth macaw, the blue-throated macaw, and the golden parakeet. These birds are threatened by habitat loss and poaching. Conservation efforts are being made to protect them and their habitats through the establishment of protected areas and conservation programs.
